result.execSummary:
The defendant Mohammad S Abulughod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a FINE of $1,000.00 PLUS ALL COSTS, FEES, and SURCHARGES by 10/14/15 or, as a penalty if not paid, serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mohammad S Abulughod in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $1,000.00 PLUS ALL COSTS, FEES, and SURCHARGES by 10/14/2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Mohammad S Abulughod in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 4/7/15 @ 3 pm
